courseDescription: The subject of this course is aircraft and rocket design. Students learn basics of aerodynamics, structures, stability, propulsion, and performance as applied to flight vehicle design. Introduces fundamentals of aerospace engineering with focus on understanding tradeoffs amongst multiple disciplines to enable vehicle-level design. Course involves combination of theory, analytic methods, computational tools, and hands-on design project.
courseApproach: Rather than deep dive into any one discipline, focus is on understanding tradeoffs amongst multiple disciplines

prerequisites.note: May be taken concurrently but may need to read ahead or ask classmates if unfamiliar with concepts

priorExperience: No prior exposure to aircraft or spacecraft assumed. Students from other departments (e.g., physics) welcome but should ask classmates for help explaining engineering concepts from fluids, dynamics, and structures
